alert.note: Alert for Grant (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 7:26PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The flooding severity has dropped from moderate to minor. The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... North Fork Whetstone River near Milbank affecting Grant County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Fork Whetstone River near Milbank. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1060.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridges on 145th Street and 480th Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 1059.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Thursday was 1061.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1056.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 430 AM CDT.
